context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: Trump strategy document singles out Russia as bad actor globally
context_meta.summary: By Steve Holland and James Oliphant WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump's administration said on Monday that Russia interferes in the domestic political affairs of countries globally, in a sober analysis of Moscow as a rival despite Trump's own bid for warmer ties with President Vladimir Putin. The criticism of Russia, laid out in a new national security strategy formed from Trump's "America First" foreign policy vision, reflects a view long held by U.S. diplomats that Russia actively undermines American interests at home and abroad. "Through modernized forms of subversive tactics, Russia interferes in the domestic political affairs of countries around the world," said the document.

context_meta.author: Yahoo News
context_meta.title: Trump judge pick who drew ridicule after hearing withdraws
context_meta.summary: WASHINGTON (AP) — A Trump judicial nominee whose inability to answer basic legal questions at his confirmation hearing brought him widespread ridicule has withdrawn, a White House official said Monday.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Trump: Train crash shows need for infrastructure fix. Details to come.
context_meta.summary: President Trump used the occasion of Monday’s fatal train crash in Washington State to tout his proposed infrastructure plan – one he has been promising since before the election but has yet to be announced.

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: North Korea: 'Trump Should Cool His Head and Face Up to Reality' About Nuclear War
context_meta.summary: North Korea urged President Donald Trump to ease his hard-line stance against the reclusive, militarized state, warning that the Republican leader's actions have brought the world to the brink of an all-out nuclear war. North Korea's official Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) published Monday a commentary titled "Trump Should Cool His Jets and Face Up to Reality." Citing foreign media reports, including Newsweek's coverage of a poll that found nearly two-thirds of U.S. citizens were against going to war with North Korea, the state-run outlet called on Trump and his administration to rescind their threat to forcefully disarm supreme leader Kim Jong Un's nuclear and ballistic arsenal, which has continued to grow despite increased U.S.-led diplomatic, economic and military pressures. "The public opinion opposed to the preemptive attack is getting stronger in the U.S. It can be viewed as a sort of advice that the U.S. administration should drop the adventurous and risky way of thinking and boldly make a U-turn in its policy toward the DPRK," the commentary read, referring to North Korea by an acronym for its official name: the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: Puerto Rico To Review Hurricane Death Toll After Undercounting Concerns
context_meta.summary: Puerto Rico’s governor vowed to re-examine its official death toll from Hurricane Maria after independent investigations placed the number of storm-related deaths at roughly 15 times higher than the territory’s findings, The New York Times reported.

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: UN to vote on requiring US to rescind Jerusalem declaration
context_meta.summary: UNITED NATIONS (AP) — The U.N. Security Council scheduled a vote Monday on a resolution that would require the United States to rescind its declaration of Jerusalem as the capital of Israel, a move aimed at showing the depth of global opposition to President Donald Trump's action.

context_meta.title: Danica Patrick, Ricky Stenhouse Jr. break up after five years together
context_meta.summary: Danica Patrick and Ricky Stenhouse Jr. were a couple while racing against each other since 2013.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Twitter suspends far-right Britain First leaders retweeted by Donald Trump
context_meta.summary: Britain First’s Jayda Fransen, 31, had her account closed by the social media network weeks after the U.S. President shared anti-Muslims videos she posted. Paul Golding, the leader of the group, has also been suspended as has the Britain First Twitter page. The suspensions on Monday are some of the most notable as Twitter begins enforcing new rules that will suspend accounts affiliated with hate groups.

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Federal Judge Announces Retirement After Sexual Misconduct Allegations
context_meta.summary: A federal judge on Monday announced his retirement from the bench, in response to accusations of serial sexual misconduct, including groping and showing pornography to his female law clerks and staffers.

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: China Calls Trump ‘Irrational’ and ‘Reckless’ Over Plans to Label Country a ‘Strategic Competitor’
context_meta.summary: China has branded President Donald Trump's plans to label the country as a strategic competitor “reckless” and “irrational,” according to Chinese state media. The Financial Times reported this weekend that Trump would refer to China as a “strategic competitor” in a foreign policy speech he is due to give Monday. It also responded to national security adviser H.R. McMaster’s comments about China's “economic aggression” to a U.K. think tank last Tuesday.

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: Does Donald Trump Think He’s Psychic? President Insists He Can Predict GOP Wins in 2018
context_meta.summary: Addressing the Republican Party’s recent defeat in the special election in Alabama and gubernatorial loss in Virginia, the president said he was aware that Roy Moore and Ed Gillespie would lose and had also successfully predicted his own 2016 presidential election win. “Remember, Republicans are 5-0 in Congressional Races this year,” the president wrote on Twitter on Monday morning.

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: Is Al Franken Really Resigning? Democrats Were Hypocritical While Republicans Never Left Trump, Senators Say
context_meta.summary: Some Democratic U.S. senators are reportedly regretting their calls for Minnesota’s Al Franken to resign amid accusations of sexual misconduct. At least four are now second-guessing their statements against Franken, raising the question of whether the disgraced senator will still step down. One is Senator Joe Manchin of West Virginia, who told Politico he felt the way Democrats abandoned Franken was “atrocious.” He also cried hypocrisy over how members of the party treated Franken following his resignation speech.

context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: McCain's Absence Probably Won't Hurt The GOP's Tax Bill Vote
context_meta.summary: Sen. John McCain is in Arizona recovering from his brain cancer treatment. And it looks like he won't be back in time for the final GOP tax bill vote.

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: Donald Trump Jr. Mocks Barack Obama With Giant Cookie in Ted Cruz Instagram Post
context_meta.summary: President Donald Trump’s eldest son said the cookie was an early birthday president. “With friends like these... some good friends decided that while my birthday is not for 2 weeks that they would get me an early 40th birthday cake. In the image Ted Cruz appeared unmoved by the cookie, looking into the camera with little emotion.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: U.S. taxpayers rush to claim deductions under threat from tax bill
context_meta.summary: Financial advisers and accountants are working overtime as many U.S. taxpayers scramble to pay the rest of their 2017 taxes before Jan. 1 when the proposed Republican tax overhaul would sharply cut the amount they can deduct on federal tax bills. The tax legislation, which top U.S. Republicans said on Sunday they expected Congress to pass this week, caps the amount of state, local and property taxes individuals can deduct from their federal tax bills at $10,000. The average American who itemized his or her tax bill in 2015 claimed more than $27,000 in deductions.

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: Sandy Hook Mom Slams Trump For Partying With NRA Head On Massacre Anniversary
context_meta.summary: The mother of one of the 20 children killed in the Sandy Hook Elementary School mass shooting in Newtown, Connecticut in 2012 slammed President Donald Trump on Sunday for his “appalling lack of humanity and decency.”

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: If Trump Fires Mueller, Americans Should Take To The Streets In Mass Protest
context_meta.summary: If President Donald Trump fires special counsel Robert Mueller or significantly hampers his ongoing investigation of Russian interference in last year's presidential election, the American masses should rally in opposition, former Attorney General Eric Holder said on Twitter on Sunday. Holder, who served under President Barack Obama from 2009 to 2015, tweeted earlier in the week denouncing the “rumor on the Hill” that Trump intends to fire Mueller next week when Congress is gone for the holidays.

context_meta.summary: In possibly one of the least expected beefs of 2017, Mark Hamill and Senator Ted Cruz (R-Tex.) took a few jabs at each other via Twitter after Hamill posted a scathing tweet slamming FCC Chairman Ajit Pai for the net neutrality ruling. In his original tweet calling out Pai, Hamill included a screencap of Pai […]

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Ralph Northam Draws Progressive Ire Over Medicaid Comments
context_meta.summary: WASHINGTON ― Virginia Gov.-elect Ralph Northam drew the ire of progressives on Sunday, who accused him of walking back ― before even taking office ― his promise to expand Medicaid for more low-income people.

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: CDC barred from using terms like 'science-based' in budget docs
context_meta.summary: According to The Washington Post, the Trump administration has prohibited the CDC from using "vulnerable," "entitlement," "diversity," "transgender," "fetus," "evidence-based" and "science-based" -- terms you'd expect to be part of CDC's everyday vocabulary. CDC's senior officials in charge of its budget have apparently revealed the new edict to the agency's policy analysts in a 90-minute meeting. WaPo's source said attendees couldn't believe what they were hearing, especially since the administration didn't even offer an explanation.

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: The Trump tax cuts would save me $2,100
context_meta.summary: Under the final tax bill President Trump is poised to sign within days, this reporter's annual tax payment would drop by about $2,100, compared with what he paid in 2016.
